Understanding road signs is crucial for: Understanding road signs is crucial for safe driving in Alberta. These signs provide vital information about regulations, warnings, and guidance. Here's a look at some key road signs you'll encounter and their meanings.
These signs inform you of traffic laws a: These signs inform you of traffic laws and regulations. You must obey them.
An octagon-shaped red sign instructing d: An octagon-shaped red sign instructing drivers to come to a complete stop before the stop line, crosswalk, or intersection, and yield to cross traffic or pedestrians.
A downward-pointing red and white triang: A downward-pointing red and white triangle indicating that you must slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary, giving the right-of-way to other traffic or pedestrians.
A red circle with a white horizontal bar: A red circle with a white horizontal bar, indicating that vehicles are prohibited from entering a particular roadway or area.
A black arrow making a U-turn with a red: A black arrow making a U-turn with a red circle and slash, meaning U-turns are not permitted.
A black arrow pointing left with a red c: A black arrow pointing left with a red circle and slash, indicating that left turns are not allowed.
A rectangular white sign with a black ar: A rectangular white sign with a black arrow, indicating that traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow.
A rectangular white sign with black text: A rectangular white sign with black text, indicating the maximum legal speed for the road section.
These signs warn you of potential hazard: These signs warn you of potential hazards ahead, requiring you to exercise caution.
A diamond-shaped yellow sign with a blac: A diamond-shaped yellow sign with a black symbol of a pedestrian, warning of a designated pedestrian crossing ahead.
A pentagon-shaped sign (often fluorescen: A pentagon-shaped sign (often fluorescent yellow-green) indicating a school area or school crossing ahead, typically with reduced speed limits when active.
A circular yellow sign with a black 'X': A circular yellow sign with a black 'X' and 'RR' indicating a railway crossing ahead. Be prepared to stop for trains.
A diamond-shaped yellow sign with a blac: A diamond-shaped yellow sign with a black arrow curving, warning of a curve in the road ahead. Adjust your speed accordingly.
A diamond-shaped yellow sign with a car: A diamond-shaped yellow sign with a car skidding, warning that the road surface may become slippery in wet conditions.
A diamond-shaped yellow sign with a deer: A diamond-shaped yellow sign with a deer symbol, indicating areas where deer frequently cross the road. Drive with caution, especially at dawn and dusk.
An orange diamond-shaped sign warning of: An orange diamond-shaped sign warning of construction or maintenance work ahead. Expect reduced speeds, lane closures, or workers.
These signs provide information about ro: These signs provide information about routes, directions, destinations, and points of interest.
Typically a rectangular green sign with: Typically a rectangular green sign with white lettering, indicating directions and distances to cities or towns.
A blue square sign with a white 'H' (and: A blue square sign with a white 'H' (and often a cross), indicating the presence or direction to a hospital or medical facility.
A blue square sign with a white gas pump: A blue square sign with a white gas pump symbol, indicating the presence or direction to a fuel station.
A blue square sign with a picnic table s: A blue square sign with a picnic table symbol, indicating a rest area or picnic site ahead.
A square blue sign with a white 'P' (and: A square blue sign with a white 'P' (and sometimes additional rules), indicating areas where parking is permitted.
A yellow diamond-shaped sign with two ar: A yellow diamond-shaped sign with two arrows separated by a median, warning that the highway ahead will become divided.
This sign indicates that the road ahead: This sign indicates that the road ahead is a two-way street, where traffic travels in opposite directions on the same roadway. Exercise caution for oncoming vehicles.
This sign instructs drivers to keep to t: This sign instructs drivers to keep to the right side of the road, especially when encountering oncoming traffic or when multiple lanes are available, to facilitate smooth traffic flow.
This sign warns that the width of the ro: This sign warns that the width of the road ahead will decrease from both the left and right sides. Be prepared to merge or adjust your position, and be aware of potential bottlenecks.
This sign means you are not allowed to s: This sign means you are not allowed to stop your vehicle in the designated area for any reason, even briefly to pick up or drop off passengers. This typically applies to zones needing constant traffic flow.
This sign warns drivers that there is a: This sign warns drivers that there is a designated school bus stop ahead. Be prepared to slow down and stop if the school bus activates its flashing red lights to pick up or drop off children.
This sign warns drivers of a section of: This sign warns drivers of a section of road with uneven or rough pavement. Reduce your speed and maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel to safely navigate the surface.
This sign indicates that the road ahead: This sign indicates that the road ahead has no outlet or through access, meaning it terminates in a cul-de-sac or a blocked passage. You will need to turn around.
Bump or Uneven Pavement on the Road Ahea: Bump or Uneven Pavement on the Road Ahead
This sign warns of a raised area or an u: This sign warns of a raised area or an uneven surface on the road, such as a speed bump or severe irregularities. Slow down to avoid damage to your vehicle or loss of control.
This sign indicates a playground zone, w: This sign indicates a playground zone, where children may be playing nearby. Speed limits are typically reduced (e.g., to 30 km/h) during specific hours, and extra caution is required.
This sign warns drivers of a series of c: This sign warns drivers of a series of curves or turns ahead. Reduce your speed and be prepared to steer through the turns to maintain control of your vehicle.
This regulatory sign requires you to slo: This regulatory sign requires you to slow down and, if necessary, stop to give the right-of-way to vehicles and pedestrians already in the intersection or on the roadway you are entering.
This sign indicates a circular intersect: This sign indicates a circular intersection (roundabout) ahead. You must yield to traffic already in the roundabout and enter when there is a safe gap.
This sign reminds drivers and cyclists t: This sign reminds drivers and cyclists that they must share the road safely. It often indicates areas where cyclists are common, encouraging drivers to be mindful of bicycles.
This sign marks a school crosswalk, aler: This sign marks a school crosswalk, alerting drivers to watch for students crossing the road. Be prepared to stop and yield to pedestrians in the crosswalk.
This sign indicates that vehicles carryi: This sign indicates that vehicles carrying dangerous goods must take specific routes or adhere to certain regulations. It's often accompanied by symbols denoting the type of hazardous material. Affected area
This sign warns that the right lane ahea: This sign warns that the right lane ahead will terminate or merge into the adjacent lane. Drivers in the ending lane must safely merge left, yielding to traffic in the through lane.
A reflective orange triangle with a red: A reflective orange triangle with a red border is mounted on the rear of vehicles that typically travel at speeds of 40 km/h or less. It warns other drivers to slow down.
This sign indicates that traffic in the: This sign indicates that traffic in the lane or at the intersection can only make a right turn. Straight-through or left turns are not permitted.
